repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
I thought maybe an appropriate way to handle
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/24579 would be with putting a doc about Bram directly in the NeoVim manual. I'm sure other people have more that they could say, and I'm also totally willing to let this PR be closed because it's off topic for the rest of the docs but I just sort of felt like something should be distributed with every copy of NeoVim that said a little bit about how at least some of us feel right now.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
Bram Moolenaar                                    *Bram* *brammool*
```

I like it; it's respectful without being cloying.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,6 +193,16 @@ Elvis	Another Vi clone, made by Steve Kirkendall.  Very compact but isn't
 
 Vim	Nvim is based on Vim.  https://www.vim.org/
 
+==============================================================================
+Bram Moolenaar                                    *Bram* *bram*

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
Nvim is a text editor built as a continuation of Vim, Vi Improved. Vim was
orginally developed by Bram Moolenaar.  Searching his name within the source
code of Nvim will reveal just how much of his work still remains in
Nvim.  On August 3, 2023, he passed away at the age of 62.  If Vim or Nvim
```
The text editor is called "Nvim" (launched through the command `nvim`). "Neovim" is the whole project.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,6 +193,16 @@ Elvis	Another Vi clone, made by Steve Kirkendall.  Very compact but isn't
 
 Vim	Nvim is based on Vim.  https://www.vim.org/
 
+==============================================================================
+Bram Moolenaar                                    *Bram* *bram*
+
+NeoVim is a text editor built as a continuation of Vim, Vi Improved. Vim was
+orginally developed by Bram Moolenaar.  Searching his name within the source
+code of NeoVim will reveal just how much of his work still remains in
+NeoVim.  On August 3, 2023, he passed away at the age of 62.  If Vim or NeoVim

comment_data.body:
That's the only thing I'm not 100% sure about; I'd prefer not to write anything on somebody else's behalf -- certainly not the Vim developers, who haven't made any official statements yet. Maybe just combine these two paragraphs and end this sentence after "show your appreciation for the work of Bram"?

(Or just not touch this section at all and wait what Vim will write here, once they have sorted everything out. There's no reason to rush this.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -71,12 +71,12 @@ If Nvim crashes, try to get a backtrace.  See |debug.txt|.
 Sponsor Vim/Nvim development				*sponsor* *register*
 
 Fixing bugs and adding new features takes a lot of time and effort.  To show
-your appreciation for the work and motivate Bram and others to continue
+your appreciation for the work and motivate Vim developers to continue

comment_data.body: I went back and forth on changes to this section. I'll leave it untouched for now, and the new section can be the extent of the changes

comment_data.body: I also don't think "continuation" is the right word here.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -193,6 +193,16 @@ Elvis	Another Vi clone, made by Steve Kirkendall.  Very compact but isn't
 
 Vim	Nvim is based on Vim.  https://www.vim.org/
 
+==============================================================================
+Bram Moolenaar                                    *Bram* *brammool*
+
+Nvim is a text editor built as a continuation of Vim, Vi Improved.  Vim was

comment_data.body:
"fork" is how we usually describe it, or "based on Vim" (see `:h nvim`).

"Continuation" implies that Vim has ended and that Nvim is picking up where it left off, both of which are very much not the case.

comment_regular_data.body: Not bad. Should live in `:help intro` somewhere.

@justinmk I added it just after `:h Credits` since I felt that was the most fitting place while reviewing `intro`. I also adjusted a couple of places to reflect that he can no longer continue to develop Vim (obviously). I felt... ungood about it. It feels weird to be grieving someone I've never met or spoke with directly. I'm sure someone else can come up with better phrasing, so I'm going to leave this as a draft for now
@justinmk , do I need  to squash my commits so that the github generated "change accepted" commits aren't upsetting the linter?
We can (and will) squash when merging.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: docs(Bram): A sad farewell
